meanings.definition: A mythical bird often associated with thunder and lightning.
meanings.sent1: Legends tell of powerful thunderbirds soaring through stormy skies.
meanings.sent2: The ancient tale spoke of a majestic thunderbird ruling the heavens.
meanings.sent3: In the story, the thunderbirds brought rain to the dry lands with their mighty wings.
meanings.sent4: The thunderbird's wings crackled with electricity as it flew through the dark clouds.
meanings.sent5: Children listened in awe to the stories of the fearsome thunderbirds in the night.

meanings.definition: A team of pilots who fly advanced aircraft in a popular television show.
meanings.sent1: The thunderbirds zoomed across the screen in their high-tech jets.
meanings.sent2: Fans eagerly awaited the next episode featuring the daring thunderbirds.
meanings.sent3: The thunderbirds always saved the day with their incredible flying skills.
meanings.sent4: Viewers were captivated by the thrilling maneuvers of the skilled thunderbirds.
meanings.sent5: The team of thunderbirds inspired many young children to dream of becoming pilots.

meanings.definition: A Native American symbol representing power and protection.
meanings.sent1: The thunderbird symbol was carved into the totem pole as a sign of strength.
meanings.sent2: People believed wearing the thunderbird emblem brought them good fortune.
meanings.sent3: The thunderbird amulet was said to shield its wearer from harm in battle.
meanings.sent4: The chief proudly displayed the thunderbird banner during the tribal ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The thunderbird image was painted on the shields for added protection in war.
